result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Kloss III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Physical Abuse of Child- Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice returned as undeliverable

3:28 PM case called. Defendant James E. Kloss III in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James E. Kloss III.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Dept of Corrections PSI writer is present. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense makes corrections to pages 7 and 15 of the revocation packet. 
Department of corrections is recommending Probation. 
State recommends 2-3 years initial confinement on count 1 and as to count 3, a 3 year probation sentence to run consecutive to count 1. State makes an argument for their recommendation. 
Defense asks the Court to follow the DOC recommendation or that the court consider an imposed and stayed prison sentence as to count 1. 
Defense makes a statement before sentencing. Court makes a statement before sentencing and addresses all of the sentencing factors the court must consider. 
Court orders: 
As to count 1: 2 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision. 
As to count 3: Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 years Probation consecutive to count 1. 
Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP. 
Defendant has 170 days sentence credit. 
Conditions of Probation and Extended Supervision include: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Defendant to comply with DHS directive and program recommendations. 
No Contact with J.K. without her approval and the approval of the probation agent. 
No contact with D.K., M.K., W.K., R.K., B.K. or H.K. without the approval of J.K. and the approval of the probation agent. Any contact, even with approval, is to be supervised. 
Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges.
*CONFIDENTIAL*

RETURN TO SENDER. Per USPS label: Attempted-Not Known; Unable to forward.
Time to Pay Summary.
Defendant's Attachment to Plea Questionnaire
Sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

4:08 PM case 22CF403 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E. Kloss III in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for James E. Kloss III. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. The defendant would like to accept the State's offer which the Defense recites. Defense states the maximum penalties and what the State would have to prove as to Count 4. Defendant enters No Contest pleas to Counts 1, 3, 4 and 6 as charged in the Amended Information. 
Court and Defense have a colloquy regarding the plea paperwork regarding Count 4- oversight that it was not included on the plea paperwork. 
Defendant acknowledges Count 4 is not on the paperwork and still intended to enter a No Contest plea to Count 4. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court explains the PSI process to the defendant and that the Court is not bound by any recommendation by the DOC or the parties. 
Both parties ask the court to order a PSI as to Counts 1 and 3. Both parties are free to argue sentencing. 
Court orders PSI as to counts 1 and 3. 
As to counts 4 and 6: Court orders court costs including applicable surcharges. 
A Sentencing Hearing is scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 3:30 PM (one hour, in person).
Adding Counts 8 and 9- Felony Intimidation of Victim as Domestic.

Case called at 2:00 PM.
Defendant James E. Kloss III in court, in custody with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Counsel jointly requests the matter be set for a 3 Day Jury Trial.
Defense requests the $25,000 Cash Bond be amended to allow the Defendant's release from jail (Defendant unable to post $25,000, can reside locally with his sister).
State objects (No changes in circumstances, continued contact with victim despite a No Contact Order, high lethality factors, history of failing to appear, disregard for court orders). Motion to modify the bond is denied.
Branch 2 to schedule STC and 3 Day Jury Trial.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
